2.text: Cut each potato into 1⁄4 to 3⁄4 inch (0.64 to 1.91 cm) slices.

3.text: Stack the potato slices and cut them into 1⁄4 inch (0.64 cm) wide strips.

6.text: Push a potato onto the safeguard.

7.text: Run the potato up and down the mandoline to slice it.

8.text: Soak the shoestring potatoes until you're ready to fry them.

9.text: Cut each potato into 1⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) thick slices.

10.text: Stack the slices of potato and cut them into 1⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) wide strips.

11.text: Cut the potato strips into 1⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) cubes.

12.text: in a skillet until they're crispy on the outside.

13.text: Rinse the potatoes and pat them dry.

14.text: Slice the potatoes at an angle to make 1⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) thick wedges.
